title: Cross Mark

verbs: To perform a multiplication on a number.
To make something legally invalid or void.
To make invalid. Especially applied to contract law.
To prohibit the use of a document as a contract.
To void or suppress (a subpoena, decision, etc.).
nouns: An x mark is a mark used to indicate the concept of negation as well as affirmation.
A common written symbol of negation or affirmation
The process of computing the sum of a number with itself a specified number of times, or any other analogous binary operation that combines other mathematical objects.<!--
The times are the circumstances of a certain period or era in time.
Multiplication is the third basic mathematical operation of arithmetic, the others being addition, subtraction and division.
An elementary arithmetic operation where a number is added to itself for a specified amount of times.
An arithmetic operation that is the inverse of division; the product of two numbers is computed

description: A large red cross mark, displayed in the shape of a letter X and similar to a multiplication sign.
apple_vendor_description: The cross mark emoji on Apple devices is a bold, vibrant red, rendered with a satisfyingly crisp appearance and subtle 3D shading that gives it a palpable presence. Its clean lines and smooth edges are a hallmark of Apple's design aesthetic, making it instantly recognizable. This emoji on Apple devices is universally understood as a symbol of negation, error, or a completed task, often used to indicate something is wrong, canceled, or finished.
